title: Spicy Thai Basil Chicken
description: A quick and flavorful Thai dish with chicken, fresh basil, and chili peppers.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken thighs, thinly sliced
instructions: Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add garlic and chilies, stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add chicken and cook until browned. Stir in sauces and sugar. Toss in basil leaves and bell peppers, cook until just wilted.

title: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
description: A rich and creamy Italian rice dish with sautéed mushrooms and parmesan cheese.
instructions: Sauté mushrooms until golden and set aside. In same pan, cook onions until translucent, add garlic and rice, toast for 2 minutes. Add wine and reduce. Gradually add warm broth, stirring constantly until rice is creamy and al dente. Fold in mushrooms, parmesan, and butter.

title: Fresh Mango Salsa
description: A vibrant and refreshing salsa with sweet mango, jalapeño, and lime juice.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Toss gently to mix. Let sit for at least 15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.

title: Classic French Ratatouille
description: A rustic Provençal vegetable stew with eggplant, zucchini, peppers, and tomatoes.
instructions: Sauté each vegetable separately until golden and set aside. In the same pot, cook onions and garlic until soft. Add tomatoes and herbs, simmer for 10 minutes. Return all vegetables to the pot, cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Season to taste.

title: Homemade Sourdough Bread
description: A tangy, crusty artisan bread with a chewy interior made from natural sourdough starter.
instructions: Mix flour, water, and starter until combined. Rest for 30 minutes. Add salt and fold dough. Perform stretch and folds every 30 minutes for 2.5 hours. Shape and place in proofing basket. Refrigerate overnight. Bake in preheated Dutch oven at 450°F for 30 minutes covered, 15 minutes uncovered.

title: Butternut Squash Soup
description: A smooth, velvety soup made with roasted butternut squash, warming spices, and a hint of cream.
ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: Roast squash at 400°F for 25 minutes until tender. Sauté onions, carrots, and garlic until soft. Add roasted squash, broth, and spices. Simmer for 20 minutes. Blend until smooth. Stir in cream and season to taste. Garnish with pumpkin seeds.

title: Beef Bourguignon
description: A classic French beef stew braised in red wine with bacon, mushrooms, and pearl onions.
ingredients: 3 lbs beef chuck, cut into 2-inch cubes
instructions: Cook bacon until crisp. Sear beef cubes and set aside. Sauté vegetables in the same pot. Add beef, bacon, wine, broth, tomato paste, and herbs. Simmer covered for 2-3 hours until meat is tender. Sauté mushrooms and pearl onions separately. Make a beurre manié with butter and flour, stir into stew to thicken. Add mushrooms and onions before serving.

title: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
description: Creamy smashed avocado on toasted sourdough bread topped with a perfectly poached egg and red pepper flakes.
ingredients: 1 tbsp chopped fresh herbs (cilantro, chives, or parsley)
instructions: Toast bread until golden. Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Bring water to simmer in a pan, add vinegar. Poach eggs for 3-4 minutes. Spread avocado mixture on toast, top with poached egg. Season with salt, pepper, red pepper flakes, and fresh herbs.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Grilled chicken chunks in a rich, spiced tomato and cream sauce, a popular Indian restaurant classic.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless chicken breasts, cut into chunks
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and half the spices for at least 2 hours. Grill chicken until charred. In a pot, sauté onions, garlic, and ginger. Add remaining spices and cook until fragrant. Add tomato sauce and simmer. Stir in cream and grilled chicken. Simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

title: Classic Caesar Salad
description: A traditional Caesar salad with crisp romaine lettuce, homemade croutons, parmesan cheese, and creamy Caesar dressing.
instructions: For dressing, whisk together anchovies, garlic, egg yolk, mustard, and lemon juice. Slowly add oil while whisking. In a large bowl, toss romaine with enough dressing to coat. Add croutons and most of the parmesan. Toss again. Top with remaining parmesan and freshly ground black pepper.

title: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
description: A nutritious bowl featuring quinoa, roasted vegetables, chickpeas, and a lemon tahini dressing.
instructions: Cook quinoa in broth. Toss vegetables and chickpeas with oil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Roast at 425°F for 25 minutes. Make dressing by whisking tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and enough water to reach desired consistency. Assemble bowls with quinoa, roasted vegetables, chickpeas, tomatoes, olives, and feta. Drizzle with tahini dressing.

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
description: Decadent individual chocolate cakes with a molten chocolate center, served warm.
ingredients: Butter and cocoa powder for ramekins
Optional: vanilla ice cream for serving
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Butter and dust four ramekins with cocoa powder. Melt chocolate and butter together. Whisk in powdered sugar. Add eggs, yolks, and vanilla, whisk until smooth. Fold in flour and salt. Pour into ramekins. Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are firm but centers are soft. Let stand 1 minute, then invert onto plates. Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately.

title: Pad Thai
description: A classic Thai stir-fried noodle dish with a perfect balance of sweet, sour, and savory flavors.
instructions: Soak rice noodles in hot water until softened. Mix sauce ingredients. Heat oil in wok, add garlic and tofu (or protein), cook until golden. Push to side, add eggs and scramble. Add drained noodles and sauce, toss until absorbed. Add bean sprouts and green onions, toss quickly. Serve topped with peanuts, cilantro, and lime wedges.

title: Homemade Pizza Dough
description: A versatile pizza dough that creates a crispy yet chewy crust, perfect for any topping combination.
instructions: Combine yeast, sugar, and warm water, let sit until foamy (5-10 minutes). In a large bowl, mix flour and salt. Add yeast mixture and olive oil, mix until dough forms. Knead on floured surface for 10 minutes until smooth. Place in oiled bowl, cover, and let rise until doubled (about 1 hour). Punch down, divide into 2-3 portions. Use immediately or refrigerate.

title: Guacamole
description: A fresh and flavorful Mexican dip made with mashed avocados, lime, and spices.
instructions: Cut avocados in half, remove pits, and scoop flesh into bowl. Mash with fork, leaving some chunks. Add lime juice, onion, tomatoes, jalapeño, cilantro, garlic, and cumin. Mix gently. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover with plastic wrap touching the surface and refrigerate until ready to serve.

title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
description: A quick Chinese-inspired stir-fry with tender beef strips and crisp-tender broccoli in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain
instructions: Marinate beef in soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch for 15 minutes. Mix sauce ingredients. Heat oil in wok over high heat. Stir-fry beef in batches until browned, remove. Add more oil if needed, stir-fry garlic and ginger for 30 seconds. Add broccoli and bell pepper, stir-fry for 3-4 minutes. Return beef to wok. Add sauce, cook until thickened. Serve with rice.

title: Strawberry Spinach Salad
description: A refreshing salad with fresh strawberries, spinach, feta cheese, and a balsamic vinaigrette.
instructions: Toast almonds in a dry pan until golden. Whisk together dressing ingredients. In a large bowl, combine spinach, strawberries, feta, and onion. Just before serving, add almonds and drizzle with dressing. Toss gently to combine.

title: Homemade Pasta
description: Fresh egg pasta made from scratch, perfect for a variety of Italian dishes.
instructions: Mound flour on surface, create a well in center. Crack eggs into well, add oil and salt. Beat eggs with fork, gradually incorporating flour. When mixture becomes too thick, use hands to form dough. Knead for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Wrap in plastic and rest for 30 minutes. Divide into portions and roll out with pasta machine or rolling pin to desired thickness. Cut into desired shapes. Cook in salted boiling water for 2-3 minutes until al dente.

title: Lemon Garlic Roast Chicken
description: A juicy whole roasted chicken infused with lemon, garlic, and herbs.
ingredients: 2 lemons, one zested and juiced, one quartered
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F. Mix butter with lemon zest, half the garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper. Pat chicken dry. Gently loosen skin and spread butter mixture underneath. Place onion, lemon quarters, and remaining garlic inside cavity. Tie legs together. Place vegetables in roasting pan, place chicken on top. Drizzle with oil, lemon juice, and season. Roast for 1 hour and 20 minutes or until juices run clear. Rest for 10-15 minutes before carving.

title: Vegetable Lasagna
description: A hearty vegetarian lasagna layered with roasted vegetables, spinach, ricotta, and a flavorful tomato sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss vegetables with oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 25 minutes. Reduce oven to 375°F. Mix ricotta, egg, parmesan, spinach, and herbs. In a 9x13 dish, spread some sauce. Layer: noodles, ricotta mixture, roasted vegetables, sauce, mozzarella. Repeat layers twice. Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes. Uncover and bake 10 more minutes until bubbly and golden. Let rest 15 minutes before serving.

title: Apple Crisp
description: A warm dessert featuring tender baked apples topped with a crispy oat and brown sugar streusel.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Toss apples with lemon juice, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Place in 9x9 baking dish. In a bowl, combine oats, flour, brown sugar, and salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over apples. Bake for 40-45 minutes until topping is golden and filling is bubbly. Serve warm, optionally with vanilla ice cream.

title: Beef Tacos
description: Classic Mexican-style tacos with seasoned ground beef, fresh toppings, and warm tortillas.
instructions: Brown ground beef in skillet, drain excess fat. Add taco seasoning and water, simmer for 5 minutes. Warm tortillas in oven or microwave. Serve beef in tortillas with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, onion, cilantro, sour cream, and salsa. Squeeze lime over tacos before eating.

title: Banana Bread
description: Moist and flavorful quick bread made with ripe bananas, perfect for breakfast or snacking.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter a 4x8 inch loaf pan. Mix mashed bananas with melted butter. Stir in sugar, egg, and vanilla. Sprinkle baking soda and salt over mixture. Add flour and cinnamon, mix just until combined. Fold in walnuts if using. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then on rack.

title: Vegetable Biryani
description: Aromatic Indian rice dish with mixed vegetables, spices, and herbs, layered and slow-cooked to perfection.
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes
4 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, potatoes)
Saffron strands soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk
instructions: Parboil rice with whole spices until 70% done, drain. Sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, tomatoes, and spices, cook until soft. Add vegetables, yogurt, half the herbs, salt, cook until nearly tender. In a heavy pot, layer half the rice, then all of the vegetable mixture, then remaining rice. Pour saffron milk on top. Cover tightly with foil, then lid. Cook on low heat for 20 minutes. Let rest 10 minutes. Garnish with remaining herbs.

title: Classic Beef Burger
description: Juicy homemade beef patty on a toasted bun with all the classic toppings.
instructions: Mix ground beef with Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Form into 4 patties, making a slight depression in the center. Grill or pan-fry patties to desired doneness (about 4 minutes each side for medium). During last minute of cooking, add cheese to melt and toast buns. Assemble burgers with condiments and toppings of choice.

title: Tom Kha Gai (Thai Coconut Chicken Soup)
description: A fragrant Thai soup with coconut milk, chicken, galangal, lemongrass, and lime.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken thighs, thinly sliced
2 stalks lemongrass, bruised and cut into 2-inch pieces
instructions: In a pot, bring broth, coconut milk, galangal, lemongrass, and kaffir lime leaves to a simmer. Add chicken and mushrooms, simmer until chicken is cooked through. Remove from heat. Stir in fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar. Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve in bowls garnished with chilies, cilantro, and green onions.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic homemade cookies with a perfect balance of chewy centers, crisp edges, and chocolate chunks.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. In a small bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, then vanilla. Gradually mix in dry ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts if using. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 9-11 minutes until golden. Cool on sheets 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks.

title: Caprese Salad
description: Simple Italian salad of fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
instructions: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a serving platter. Tuck basil leaves between slices. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately at room temperature.

title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
description: Crispy, caramelized Brussels sprouts roasted with smoky bacon and a touch of maple syrup.
ingredients: 2 lbs Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. In a large bowl, toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet. Scatter bacon pieces over sprouts. Roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway, until sprouts are tender and bacon is crispy. Remove from oven, drizzle with maple syrup and balsamic vinegar, toss to coat. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes if desired.

title: Beef Pho
description: Vietnamese noodle soup with rich beef broth, rice noodles, thinly sliced beef, and aromatic herbs.
instructions: Roast bones, onions, and ginger at 450°F for 30 minutes. Transfer to large pot with brisket, cover with water. Bring to boil, skim foam. Add spices, simmer 3 hours. Remove brisket after 1.5 hours, cool and slice. Strain broth, add fish sauce and sugar. Cook rice noodles according to package. Place noodles in bowls, top with brisket and raw sirloin. Pour hot broth over (it will cook the raw beef). Serve with garnishes.

title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
description: Juicy chicken breasts stuffed with a savory mixture of spinach, feta cheese, and herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add spinach, cook until wilted. Remove from heat, mix in feta, dill, and lemon zest. Cut pocket in chicken breasts. Stuff with spinach mixture, secure with toothpicks. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika. Heat oil in ovenproof skillet, sear chicken 3 minutes per side. Transfer skillet to oven, bake 15-20 minutes until chicken reaches 165°F.

title: Homemade Hummus
description: Smooth and creamy chickpea dip with tahini, lemon, and garlic, perfect for dipping or spreading.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
2 tbsp olive oil, plus more for serving
instructions: In a food processor, combine chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, garlic, olive oil, and cumin. Process until smooth. With machine running, add water one tablespoon at a time until desired consistency is reached. Season with salt to taste. Transfer to serving bowl, drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika and parsley. Serve with pita bread or vegetables.

title: Penne alla Vodka
description: Creamy tomato and vodka sauce with a hint of heat, tossed with penne pasta and topped with parmesan cheese.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat oil and sauté onion until translucent. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and vodka, simmer 10 minutes. Stir in cream, simmer 5 minutes. Mix in butter and half the parmesan until melted. Toss sauce with drained pasta. Garnish with remaining parmesan and basil.

title: Falafel
description: Crispy chickpea fritters seasoned with herbs and spices, a popular Middle Eastern street food.
ingredients: 2 cups dried chickpeas, soaked overnight (don't use canned)
instructions: Drain soaked chickpeas. In food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, garlic, herbs, and spices. Pulse until mixture is coarsely ground but not pureed. Add baking powder and salt, pulse briefly to combine. Refrigerate mixture for at least 1 hour. Form into small patties or balls, optionally roll in sesame seeds. Heat oil to 350°F. Fry falafels in batches until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Serve in pita with tahini sauce and vegetables.

title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
description: Quick and elegant pasta dish with succulent shrimp in a light lemon garlic sauce.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat 2 tbsp olive oil and 2 tbsp butter. Add shrimp, season with salt and pepper, cook 1-2 minutes per side until pink. Remove shrimp from pan. Add remaining oil and butter to pan. Sauté garlic and red pepper flakes for 30 seconds. Add wine, lemon juice and zest, simmer 2 minutes. Return shrimp to pan, add drained pasta, parsley, and parmesan. Toss well to combine, adding pasta water if needed to loosen sauce.

title: Classic French Onion Soup
description: Rich beef broth with caramelized onions, topped with crusty bread and melted Gruyère cheese.
instructions: In a large pot, melt butter with oil over medium heat. Add onions, cook until deeply caramelized, about 40 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add sugar halfway through to help caramelization. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Deglaze with wine, scraping up browned bits. Add broth, bay leaves, and thyme. Simmer 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Preheat broiler. Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls, top each with a slice of baguette and generous amount of cheese. Broil until cheese is bubbly and golden.

title: Shakshuka
description: Middle Eastern dish of eggs poached in a spiced tomato and pepper sauce, traditionally served for breakfast.
instructions: Heat oil in a large, deep skillet. Add onion and peppers, sauté until soft. Add garlic and spices, cook 1 minute. Pour in tomatoes, simmer 10 minutes until slightly reduced. Make 6 wells in the sauce, crack an egg into each. Cover and cook 5-7 minutes until whites are set but yolks are still runny. Sprinkle with feta and parsley. Serve directly from skillet with crusty bread.

title: Beef and Guinness Stew
description: Hearty Irish stew with tender beef, vegetables, and a rich sauce made with Guinness stout.
ingredients: 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into 1.5-inch cubes
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Season beef with salt and pepper, toss with flour. Heat oil in large Dutch oven, brown beef in batches. Remove and set aside. Add onions and garlic to pot, sauté until soft. Add vegetables, cook 5 minutes. Add Guinness, scraping up browned bits. Add broth, tomato paste, Worcestershire, herbs, and beef. Bring to simmer. Cover and transfer to oven. Cook 2.5 hours until beef is tender. Remove bay leaves and thyme sprigs. Garnish with parsley.

title: Banana Bread
description: A moist and flavorful quick bread made with ripe bananas and warm spices.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix mashed bananas with melted butter. Stir in sugar, egg, and vanilla. Sprinkle baking soda and salt over mixture and stir. Add flour and mix until just combined. Fold in nuts or chocolate chips if using. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes until toothpick comes out clean. Cool before slicing.

title: Greek Salad
description: A refreshing Mediterranean salad with crisp vegetables, feta cheese, and Kalamata olives.
instructions: Combine cucumber, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, olives, and feta in large bowl. Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Sprinkle with fresh oregano before serving.

title: Shrimp Scampi
description: Garlicky shrimp sautéed in butter and white wine, served over linguine pasta.
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Cook linguine according to package. Heat butter and oil in large skillet. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook until fragrant. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Add wine and lemon juice, simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in parsley and season. Toss with cooked linguine. Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
description: A comforting classic soup with tender chicken, vegetables, and egg noodles.
instructions: Heat oil in large pot. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery until softened. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add broth, chicken, bay leaves, thyme, and pepper. Simmer until chicken is cooked. Remove chicken, shred, and return to pot. Add noodles and cook until tender. Stir in parsley and season with salt.

title: Blueberry Pancakes
description: Fluffy buttermilk pancakes studded with fresh blueberries.
ingredients: Butter and maple syrup for serving
instructions: Whisk dry ingredients in bowl. In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla. Stir wet ingredients into dry until just combined. Fold in blueberries. Heat griddle over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form, then flip. Serve with butter and syrup.

title: Beef Tacos
description: Seasoned ground beef in crispy taco shells with all the classic toppings.
instructions: Brown beef with onion and garlic. Drain fat. Stir in taco seasoning and water. Simmer for 5 minutes. Warm taco shells according to package. Fill shells with beef mixture and desired toppings.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic chewy chocolate chip cookies with crisp edges.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Whisk flour, baking soda, and salt. Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, then vanilla. Gradually add flour mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto baking sheets. Bake for 9-11 minutes until golden. Cool on wire racks.

title: Egg Fried Rice
description: A quick and easy fried rice with scrambled eggs and vegetables.
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in wok or large skillet. Scramble eggs, remove and set aside. Heat remaining oil. Add frozen vegetables and cook until tender. Add rice and break up clumps. Stir in soy sauce, sesame oil, and garlic powder. Return eggs to pan. Add green onions. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Tomato Basil Soup
description: A creamy tomato soup with fresh basil, perfect with grilled cheese.
instructions: Melt butter in large pot. Sauté onion until soft. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes with juices, broth, basil, and sugar. Simmer for 20 minutes. Blend until smooth. Stir in cream and season with salt and pepper.

title: Garlic Butter Salmon
description: Pan-seared salmon fillets with a rich garlic butter sauce.
instructions: Season salmon with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Cook salmon skin-side down for 4 minutes. Flip and cook 3 more minutes. Remove salmon. Reduce heat, melt butter. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in lemon juice and parsley. Pour sauce over salmon. Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: A colorful mix of vegetables in a savory sauce, served over rice.
instructions: Whisk sauce ingredients. Heat oil in wok over high heat. Stir-fry vegetables until crisp-tender. Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds. Add sauce and cook until thickened. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve over rice.

title: French Onion Soup
description: A rich soup with caramelized onions, topped with toasted bread and melted cheese.
instructions: Melt butter with oil in large pot. Add onions and sugar, cook slowly until caramelized (about 45 minutes). Sprinkle flour and cook 1 minute. Add wine and reduce. Add broths and thyme. Simmer 30 minutes. Season. Ladle into oven-safe bowls. Top with bread and cheese. Broil until cheese melts.

title: Honey Garlic Chicken
description: Crispy chicken thighs in a sweet and garlicky glaze.
ingredients: Sesame seeds and green onions for garnish
instructions: Season chicken. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high. Cook chicken until crispy and cooked through. Remove. Reduce heat, add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add honey, soy sauce, vinegar, and sriracha. Simmer 2 minutes. Mix cornstarch and water, stir into sauce to thicken. Return chicken to pan and coat with sauce. Garnish and serve.

title: Mashed Potatoes
description: Creamy, buttery mashed potatoes perfect as a side dish.
instructions: Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain well. Mash with milk and butter until desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper. For extra creaminess, add sour cream. For flavor, mix in roasted garlic.

title: Pesto Pasta
description: Simple pasta tossed with fresh basil pesto and parmesan cheese.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package. For pesto, blend basil, pine nuts, garlic, and parmesan. Slowly add oil while blending. Season. Toss pesto with cooked pasta. Garnish with cherry tomatoes if desired.

title: Chicken Quesadillas
description: Crispy tortillas filled with cheese, chicken, and peppers.
ingredients: 2 cups shredded cheese (cheddar or Mexican blend)
Sour cream and salsa for serving
instructions: Mix chicken with taco seasoning. Melt butter in skillet. Place tortilla in pan, layer with cheese, chicken, vegetables, and more cheese. Top with second tortilla. Cook until golden, then flip. Repeat with remaining quesadillas. Cut into wedges and serve with sour cream and salsa.

title: Carrot Cake
description: A moist spiced cake with cream cheese frosting and walnuts.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Whisk dry ingredients. Beat eggs and sugar until light. Slowly add oil. Stir in dry ingredients. Fold in carrots and walnuts. Pour into greased pans. Bake 30-35 minutes. For frosting, beat cream cheese and butter. Add powdered sugar and vanilla. Frost cooled cake.

title: Greek Yogurt Parfait
description: Layers of Greek yogurt, granola, and fresh fruit for a healthy breakfast or snack.
instructions: In glasses or bowls, layer yogurt, granola, and fruit. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cinnamon. Repeat layers. Serve immediately.

title: Beef Bulgogi
description: Korean marinated beef that's sweet, savory, and packed with flavor.
instructions: Combine pear, soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and gochujang. Add beef and marinate for at least 1 hour. Heat oil in skillet or grill pan over high heat. Cook beef in batches until caramelized. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds. Serve with rice.

title: Caprese Salad
description: A simple Italian salad with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil.
instructions: Arrange alternating slices of tomato and mozzarella on a plate. Tuck basil leaves between slices. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Pumpkin Soup
description: A creamy autumn soup with pumpkin and warming spices.
instructions: Melt butter in pot. Sauté onion until soft. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add pumpkin, broth, and spices. Simmer 20 minutes. Blend until smooth. Stir in cream and season. Garnish with pumpkin seeds.

title: Shakshuka
description: Eggs poached in a spicy tomato and pepper sauce, a North African breakfast dish.
instructions: Heat oil in skillet. Sauté onion and pepper until soft. Add garlic and spices, cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes and simmer 10 minutes. Make wells in sauce and crack eggs into them. Cover and cook until eggs are set. Sprinkle with feta and parsley. Season. Serve with bread.

title: Chicken Parmesan
description: Breaded chicken cutlets topped with marinara and melted cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Set up breading station: flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan. Season chicken. Dredge in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs. Heat oil in skillet. Cook chicken until golden. Place in baking dish. Top with sauce and cheese. Bake until cheese melts. Garnish with basil.

title: Mushroom Stroganoff
description: A vegetarian version of the classic, with mushrooms in a creamy sauce over noodles.
instructions: Cook noodles. Melt butter in skillet. Sauté onion until soft. Add garlic and mushrooms, cook until browned. Sprinkle flour and cook 1 minute. Gradually add broth, then Worcestershire. Simmer until thickened. Stir in sour cream. Season. Serve over noodles, garnished with parsley.

title: Banana Pancakes
description: Fluffy pancakes with mashed banana throughout the batter.
instructions: Whisk dry ingredients. In another bowl, mix egg, milk, banana, butter, and vanilla. Stir into dry ingredients until just combined. Heat griddle over medium. Pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form, then flip. Serve with maple syrup.

title: Lentil Soup
description: A hearty and nutritious soup with lentils, vegetables, and spices.
instructions: Heat oil in pot. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery until soft. Add garlic and spices, cook 1 minute. Add lentils, broth, and tomatoes. Simmer 30 minutes until lentils are tender. Stir in spinach and lemon juice. Season.

title: Chocolate Mousse
description: A light and airy chocolate dessert that's rich and decadent.
instructions: Melt chocolate and let cool slightly. Beat egg yolks with half the sugar until pale. Stir into chocolate. Whip cream to soft peaks. In another bowl, beat egg whites with salt until foamy. Gradually add remaining sugar and beat to stiff peaks. Fold whipped cream into chocolate, then fold in egg whites. Divide into glasses and chill 4 hours. Garnish with whipped cream.

title: Chicken Fajitas
description: Sizzling chicken and peppers with warm tortillas and all the fixings.
instructions: Mix oil, lime juice, garlic, and spices. Toss with chicken and marinate 30 minutes. Heat skillet over high heat. Cook chicken until done, remove. Cook peppers and onion until tender. Return chicken to pan. Serve with warm tortillas and toppings.

title: Baked Ziti
description: A comforting baked pasta dish with ricotta, mozzarella, and marinara sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook pasta al dente. Mix ricotta, half the mozzarella, parmesan, egg, garlic, basil, salt, and pepper. Layer pasta, sauce, and cheese mixture in baking dish. Top with remaining mozzarella. Bake 25 minutes until bubbly.

title: Tuna Salad
description: A classic tuna salad perfect for sandwiches or lettuce wraps.
instructions: Flake tuna in bowl. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Adjust seasoning. Serve on bread or lettuce leaves.

title: Pork Chops with Apples
description: Juicy pork chops cooked with apples and onions in a savory-sweet sauce.
instructions: Season pork chops. Heat oil in skillet. Brown chops, remove. In same pan, cook apples and onion until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Stir in cider, mustard, and thyme. Return chops to pan. Simmer until pork is cooked through. Stir in butter before serving.

title: Cornbread
description: A slightly sweet, moist bread perfect with chili or soups.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Whisk dry ingredients. In another bowl, mix milk, egg, and butter. Stir into dry ingredients until just combined. Pour into greased pan. Bake 20-25 minutes until golden.

title: Chicken Satay
description: Grilled chicken skewers with peanut sauce, a popular Southeast Asian appetizer.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs chicken thighs, cut into strips
instructions: Mix marinade ingredients and coat chicken. Thread onto skewers. Grill until cooked through. For sauce, whisk all ingredients until smooth. Serve skewers with peanut sauce.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
description: Breaded eggplant slices baked with marinara and melted cheese.
instructions: Salt eggplant slices and let sit 30 minutes. Pat dry. Set up breading station: flour, eggs, and breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan. Bread eggplant slices. Heat oil in skillet and fry until golden. Layer in baking dish with sauce and cheese. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes. Garnish with basil.

title: Chicken Pot Pie
description: A comforting pie filled with chicken and vegetables in a creamy sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breasts, cooked and diced
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Melt butter in pot. Sauté vegetables until soft. Stir in flour. Gradually add broth and milk, simmer until thickened. Add chicken, peas, and seasonings. Pour into pie crust. Cover with top crust. Vent and bake 30-35 minutes until golden.

title: Miso Soup
description: A simple Japanese soup with tofu, seaweed, and miso paste.
instructions: Heat stock until simmering. Dissolve miso paste in some hot stock, then return to pot. Add tofu and seaweed (and mushrooms if using). Simmer 2-3 minutes. Garnish with green onions.

title: Pulled Pork
description: Slow-cooked pork shoulder that's tender and flavorful, perfect for sandwiches.
instructions: Mix dry rub ingredients and coat pork. Combine sauces and vinegar. Place pork in slow cooker with sauce mixture. Cook on low 8 hours. Shred pork with forks. Serve on buns with additional barbecue sauce.

title: Spinach Artichoke Dip
description: A creamy, cheesy dip with spinach and artichokes, perfect for parties.
ingredients: 10 oz frozen spinach, thawed and drained
Tortilla chips or bread for serving
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix all ingredients except 1/4 cup mozzarella. Spread in baking dish. Top with remaining mozzarella. Bake 20-25 minutes until bubbly. Serve warm with chips or bread.

title: Tiramisu
description: A classic Italian dessert made with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
instructions: Beat egg yolks and sugar until pale and thick. Gently fold in mascarpone cheese. Mix cooled coffee and liqueur. Dip each ladyfinger briefly into the coffee mixture and layer half in a serving dish. Spread half the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. Repeat layers. Dust generously with cocoa powder. Chill for at least 4 hours.

title: Chicken and Sausage Gumbo
description: A hearty Louisiana stew with a dark roux, chicken, sausage, and the 'holy trinity' of vegetables.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken thighs, cut into chunks
instructions: Make a dark roux by cooking oil and flour over medium heat, stirring constantly, until dark brown (about 30-40 minutes). Add onion, bell pepper, and celery (holy trinity), cook until softened. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Add sausage and chicken, brown lightly. Gradually whisk in chicken broth. Add bay leaves, thyme, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Simmer for at least 1 hour. Remove bay leaves. Serve over rice, garnished with green onions.

title: Kimchi Fried Rice
description: A flavorful Korean fried rice featuring tangy kimchi, often topped with a fried egg.
ingredients: 4 oz pork belly or bacon, diced (optional)
instructions: If using pork/bacon, cook in skillet until crisp. Add onion and garlic, cook until softened. Add kimchi and cook for 5 minutes. Add rice, kimchi juice, gochujang, and soy sauce. Break up rice and stir-fry until well combined and heated through. Stir in sesame oil. Serve topped with a fried egg, sesame seeds, and green onions.

title: Shepherd's Pie
description: A comforting British dish with a minced lamb filling topped with mashed potatoes.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs ground lamb (or beef for Cottage Pie)
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender, drain, mash with milk, butter, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in ovenproof skillet. Sauté onion, carrots, and celery until soft. Add ground lamb, cook until browned. Stir in tomato paste, broth, Worcestershire sauce, and rosemary. Simmer 15 minutes. Stir in peas. Top with mashed potatoes, roughing up the surface with a fork. Bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.

title: Fish Tacos with Chipotle Crema
description: Crispy fish tacos topped with slaw and a smoky chipotle sauce.
instructions: Mix flour, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. Dredge fish fillets. Heat oil in skillet, cook fish until golden and cooked through. Flake fish. Whisk slaw ingredients. Whisk crema ingredients. Warm tortillas. Assemble tacos with fish, slaw, and chipotle crema. Add optional toppings.

title: New England Clam Chowder
description: A thick, creamy chowder filled with clams, potatoes, and bacon.
ingredients: 2 cans (6.5 oz each) chopped clams, undrained
instructions: Cook bacon in large pot until crisp. Remove bacon, leave fat. Sauté onion and celery in bacon fat until tender. Stir in flour, cook 1 minute. Gradually whisk in clam juice and milk. Add potatoes and reserved clam liquid. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Stir in clams and heavy cream. Heat through but do not boil. Season with salt and pepper. Serve topped with crumbled bacon and oyster crackers.

title: French Macarons
description: Delicate almond meringue cookies with a crisp shell and chewy interior, filled with ganache or buttercream.
instructions: Sift powdered sugar and almond flour together twice. Beat egg whites with cream of tartar and salt until foamy. Gradually add granulated sugar, beat until stiff, glossy peaks form. Add food coloring if desired. Fold dry ingredients into meringue in thirds until mixture flows like lava (macaronage). Pipe small circles onto parchment-lined baking sheets. Tap sheets firmly to release air bubbles. Let rest 30-60 minutes until dry to the touch. Bake at 300°F for 15-18 minutes. Cool completely before filling.

title: Swedish Meatballs
description: Tender meatballs served in a rich, creamy gravy, often accompanied by lingonberry jam.
instructions: Soak breadcrumbs in milk. Combine meatball ingredients, mix gently. Form into small meatballs. Brown meatballs in butter, remove. Make gravy: melt butter, whisk in flour, cook 1 minute. Gradually whisk in broth. Simmer until thickened. Stir in cream, soy sauce, and mustard. Return meatballs to gravy, simmer 10 minutes. Serve with egg noodles or mashed potatoes.

title: Cobb Salad
description: A classic American composed salad with chicken, bacon, avocado, egg, tomatoes, and blue cheese.
instructions: Arrange lettuce on a large platter or in individual bowls. Arrange chicken, bacon, eggs, avocado, tomatoes, and blue cheese in neat rows over the lettuce. Sprinkle with chives. Drizzle with red wine vinaigrette just before serving.

title: Seafood Paella
description: A vibrant Spanish rice dish cooked with saffron, seafood, and vegetables in a wide, shallow pan.
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Heat oil in paella pan or large skillet. Sauté onion and pepper until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes, paprika, and saffron, cook 2 minutes. Add rice, stir to coat. Pour in broth, bring to simmer. Arrange seafood and peas over rice. Do not stir. Simmer uncovered for 20-25 minutes until rice is cooked and liquid absorbed. Let rest 10 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Black Bean Burgers
description: Flavorful and satisfying vegetarian burgers made from black beans and spices.
ingredients: 2 cans (15 oz each) black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Mash black beans in a bowl, leaving some whole. Add bell pepper, onion, garlic, egg, breadcrumbs, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Form into patties. Heat oil in skillet, cook patties 4-5 minutes per side until browned and heated through. Serve on buns with desired toppings.

title: Crème Brûlée
description: A rich custard base topped with a contrasting layer of hard caramel.
ingredients: 1 vanilla bean, split and scraped (or 1 tsp vanilla extract)
1/2 cup granulated sugar, plus more for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Heat cream and vanilla bean seeds/pod just until simmering. Remove from heat, let steep 15 minutes. Remove pod. Whisk egg yolks and 1/2 cup sugar until pale. Gradually whisk in warm cream. Pour custard into ramekins placed in a baking pan. Add hot water to pan to come halfway up sides of ramekins. Bake 30-35 minutes until centers are just set. Chill completely. Sprinkle sugar evenly over tops, caramelize with kitchen torch or under broiler.

title: Tonkotsu Ramen
description: Japanese noodle soup with a rich, cloudy pork bone broth, topped with pork belly, egg, and other garnishes.
ingredients: Toppings: Chashu pork (sliced pork belly), soft-boiled eggs (Ajitsuke Tamago), green onions, nori, menma (bamboo shoots)
instructions: Boil pork bones vigorously for 10 minutes, drain and rinse. Return bones to pot, cover with water. Add onion, ginger, garlic. Bring to boil, then simmer vigorously (rolling boil) for 8-12 hours, adding water as needed, until broth is milky white. Strain broth. Separately, roll and tie pork belly, braise until tender (can use some broth), then slice (Chashu). Cook ramen noodles. Assemble bowls: add tare to bottom, pour hot broth over, add noodles, top with Chashu, egg, and other desired toppings.

title: Chili Con Carne
description: A spicy Tex-Mex stew containing chili peppers, meat (usually beef), tomatoes, and often beans.
ingredients: Toppings: shredded cheese, sour cream, onions, cilantro
instructions: Brown ground beef in large pot, drain fat. Add onion and bell peppers, cook until softened. Add garlic and spices, cook 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes, beans, and broth. Bring to simmer, then reduce heat and cook, covered, for at least 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with desired toppings.

title: Gazpacho
description: A refreshing cold Spanish soup made from blended raw vegetables.
ingredients: 2 lbs ripe tomatoes, cored and chopped
Optional garnishes: croutons, diced cucumber, diced pepper
instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, and garlic in a blender. Blend until smooth. With blender running, slowly drizzle in olive oil. Add vinegar, salt, and pepper. Blend briefly. Taste and adjust seasoning. Chill thoroughly for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve cold, with optional garnishes.

title: Chicken Cordon Bleu
description: Chicken breast pounded thin, wrapped around ham and Swiss cheese, breaded, and baked or fried.
instructions: Pound chicken breasts thin. Season with salt and pepper. Place a slice of ham and cheese on each breast. Roll up tightly, securing with toothpicks if needed. Set up breading station: flour, eggs, breadcrumbs. Dredge chicken rolls in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs. Heat butter/oil in ovenproof skillet. Brown chicken rolls on all sides. Transfer skillet to 375°F oven and bake for 20-25 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Remove toothpicks before serving.

title: Key Lime Pie
description: A tangy and sweet American dessert with a graham cracker crust and key lime filling, topped with meringue or whipped cream.
ingredients: Optional topping: whipped cream or meringue
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix crust ingredients, press into pie plate. Bake 10 minutes. Cool. Whisk egg yolks until pale. Whisk in condensed milk, lime juice, and zest until smooth. Pour into cooled crust. Bake 15 minutes until center is just set. Cool completely, then chill for at least 3 hours. Top with whipped cream or meringue before serving.

title: Lobster Bisque
description: A smooth, creamy, and highly seasoned soup of French origin, based on a strained broth of crustaceans.
instructions: Sauté lobster shells in oil until fragrant. Add vegetables and garlic, cook until softened. Add brandy/sherry, cook until evaporated. Add stock, tomatoes, tomato paste, and bay leaves. Simmer 45 minutes. Strain broth, discarding solids. Return broth to pot. Stir in cream and butter until melted. Add chopped lobster meat, heat through. Season. Garnish with chives.

title: Bibimbap
description: A Korean mixed rice bowl topped with assorted seasoned vegetables, meat (usually beef), a fried egg, and gochujang sauce.
ingredients: Marinade: 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 clove garlic
Assorted vegetables (e.g., spinach, carrots, bean sprouts, zucchini, mushrooms), julienned
Gochujang sauce (gochujang, sesame oil, sugar, water, vinegar)
instructions: Marinate beef. Sauté each vegetable separately with a little oil and seasoning (salt, garlic). Cook marinated beef. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Assemble bowls: place rice in bottom, arrange cooked vegetables and beef artfully on top. Place fried egg in center. Serve with gochujang sauce on the side or drizzled over. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

title: Cornish Pasties
description: A traditional British baked pastry filled with beef, potato, swede (rutabaga), and onion.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cold lard or shortening, cubed
1 lb beef skirt or chuck, cubed
instructions: Make pastry: pulse flour, fats, salt until coarse crumbs. Add ice water, pulse until dough forms. Chill. Make filling: combine beef, potato, swede, onion, butter, salt, pepper. Roll out pastry, cut circles. Place filling on half of each circle. Fold pastry over, crimp edges firmly. Brush with egg wash. Cut slits in top. Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes, then 350°F for 30-40 minutes until golden.

title: Pork Gyoza
description: Japanese pan-fried dumplings filled with ground pork and vegetables.
ingredients: Dipping sauce (soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili oil)
instructions: Combine pork, cabbage, green onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and pepper. Place filling in center of wrapper, moisten edge with water. Fold in half, pleat one side to seal. Heat oil in skillet. Arrange gyoza in pan. Cook until bottoms are golden. Add water, cover, steam until water evaporates and gyoza are cooked. Serve with dipping sauce.

title: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
description: Chewy cookies packed with oats, raisins, and warm spices.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Cream butter and sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Whisk flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Gradually add to wet ingredients. Stir in oats and raisins. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes until edges are golden. Cool on wire racks.

title: Beef Wellington
description: Beef fillet coated with pâté and duxelles, wrapped in puff pastry, then baked.
ingredients: 1/4 cup pâté de foie gras or liver pâté
instructions: Sear seasoned tenderloin in oil, cool. Sauté mushrooms, shallots in butter until moisture evaporates. Add wine, cook until evaporated. Cool duxelles, mix with pâté. Lay prosciutto on plastic wrap, spread duxelles over. Place tenderloin on top, roll tightly using wrap. Chill. Roll out puff pastry. Unwrap beef, place on pastry. Brush edges with egg wash, wrap pastry around beef, trim excess. Decorate if desired. Brush with egg wash. Chill. Bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes for medium-rare.

title: Scotch Eggs
description: Hard-boiled eggs wrapped in sausage meat, coated in breadcrumbs, and deep-fried or baked.
instructions: Boil 5 eggs until slightly soft-boiled (about 6-7 minutes). Plunge into ice water, peel carefully. Mix sausage meat with sage, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Divide sausage into 5 portions. Flatten each portion and wrap around a peeled egg, sealing completely. Set up breading station: flour, beaten eggs, breadcrumbs. Roll sausage-wrapped eggs in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs. Deep fry at 350°F until golden brown and sausage is cooked through (about 5-7 minutes), or bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes.

title: Baklava
description: A rich, sweet dessert pastry made of layers of phyllo dough filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup or honey.
ingredients: 1 lb mixed nuts (walnuts, pistachios), finely chopped
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine chopped nuts and cinnamon. Brush baking pan with melted butter. Layer several sheets of phyllo, brushing each with butter. Spread half the nut mixture. Layer more phyllo sheets, brushing with butter. Spread remaining nuts. Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing with butter. Cut into diamond shapes. Bake 45-50 minutes until golden. While baking, make syrup: simmer sugar, water, honey, cinnamon stick, lemon peel for 10 minutes. Remove spices. Pour hot syrup over hot baklava. Cool completely.

title: Ceviche
description: A South American dish of raw fish cured in citrus juices, such as lemon or lime, and spiced.
ingredients: 1 lb fresh white fish (snapper, sea bass), diced
Tortilla chips or plantain chips for serving
instructions: Combine fish and lime juice in a glass bowl, ensuring fish is covered. Cover and refrigerate for 1-4 hours, until fish is opaque and 'cooked' through by the acid. Drain most of the lime juice. Gently stir in red onion, chili, cilantro, and tomato. Season with salt and pepper. Just before serving, gently fold in avocado. Serve immediately with chips.

title: Arepas
description: Venezuelan/Colombian cornmeal cakes that are grilled, baked, or fried, then split and stuffed with various fillings.
ingredients: 1 tbsp vegetable oil or melted butter
Fillings (e.g., shredded beef, chicken salad, black beans, cheese, avocado)
instructions: Combine cornmeal and salt in a bowl. Gradually add warm water and oil/butter, mixing with hands until a soft, pliable dough forms. Let rest 5 minutes. Form dough into discs about 3-4 inches wide and 1/2 inch thick. Cook on a lightly oiled griddle or skillet over medium heat for 5-7 minutes per side, until golden spots appear. Transfer to 350°F oven for 15-20 minutes until they puff slightly. Cool slightly, split horizontally, and fill.

title: Jambalaya
description: A Louisiana Creole dish of Spanish and French influence, consisting mainly of meat and vegetables mixed with rice.
instructions: Heat oil in large pot or Dutch oven. Brown sausage and chicken, remove. Add onion, pepper, celery (holy trinity), cook until soft. Add garlic, cook 1 minute. Return meat to pot. Stir in tomatoes, broth, rice, Creole seasoning, and thyme. Bring to boil, reduce heat, cover, simmer 20-25 minutes until rice is tender and liquid absorbed. If using shrimp, stir in during last 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Garnish with green onions.

title: Red Velvet Cake
description: A striking cake with a reddish hue, mild cocoa flavor, and typically paired with cream cheese frosting.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Whisk dry ingredients. In another bowl, whisk oil, buttermilk, eggs, food coloring, vanilla, and vinegar. Add wet to dry, mix until just combined. Pour into greased and floured cake pans. Bake 30-35 minutes. Cool completely. For frosting, beat cream cheese and butter until smooth. Gradually add powdered sugar, then vanilla. Beat until fluffy. Frost cooled cake.

title: Vegetable Spring Rolls
description: Crispy fried spring rolls filled with shredded vegetables, served with a dipping sauce.
ingredients: 4 cups shredded vegetables (cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts)
instructions: Heat oil in wok. Sauté garlic and ginger. Add vegetables and mushrooms, stir-fry until tender-crisp. Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil. Cool filling completely. Place filling on wrapper corner, fold corner over, fold sides in, roll tightly. Seal edge with flour paste. Heat oil for frying to 350°F. Fry spring rolls in batches until golden brown and crispy. Drain. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

title: Tabbouleh
description: A Levantine vegetarian salad made mostly of finely chopped parsley, with tomatoes, mint, onion, bulgur, and seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
ingredients: 3 cups finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
instructions: Place bulgur in a bowl, cover with boiling water. Let stand 15-20 minutes until tender. Drain well, squeezing out excess water. In a large bowl, combine drained bulgur, parsley, mint, green onions, and tomatoes. Whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.

title: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
description: A traditional Italian pasta dish coming from Naples with garlic, olive oil, parsley, and chili flakes.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes (or to taste)
instructions: Cook spaghetti in heavily salted water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup pasta water. While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-low heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook slowly until garlic is golden (do not burn). Drain pasta, add to skillet with garlic oil. Add parsley and toss well. Add reserved pasta water as needed to create a light sauce. Season with salt. Toss with Parmesan if desired.

title: Chicken Alfredo
description: Pasta tossed in a creamy parmesan cheese sauce with chicken.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips
instructions: Cook fettuccine until al dente. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in skillet, cook chicken until done. Remove chicken. In same skillet, melt butter. Add garlic, cook 30 seconds. Whisk in heavy cream, bring to simmer. Reduce heat, stir in Parmesan cheese until melted and sauce is smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Return chicken to skillet. Add cooked pasta, toss to coat. Garnish with parsley.

title: Vietnamese Summer Rolls (Goi Cuon)
description: Fresh, uncooked spring rolls filled with shrimp, pork, herbs, and rice vermicelli, served with peanut dipping sauce.
ingredients: 1/4 lb pork loin, cooked and thinly sliced
instructions: Cook rice vermicelli according to package, drain and cool. Prepare peanut sauce by whisking ingredients until smooth. Dip rice paper in warm water until pliable. Lay flat, layer lettuce, vermicelli, herbs, pork, and shrimp on lower third. Fold bottom edge over filling, fold in sides, roll tightly. Repeat. Serve immediately with peanut sauce.

title: Classic Scones with Jam and Cream
description: Light and fluffy British scones, perfect for afternoon tea served with clotted cream and strawberry jam.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk until dough just comes together. Turn onto floured surface, knead gently. Pat out to 1-inch thickness. Cut out rounds with biscuit cutter. Place on baking sheet, brush tops with egg wash. Bake 12-15 minutes until golden. Serve warm with jam and cream.
